description: A common greeting.
A farewell greeting.
Used to make a request more polite.
An expression of gratitude.
Used to apologize or express regret.
An affirmative response.
A negative response.
Used to get someone's attention or apologize.
Assistance or support.
A person you like and enjoy being with.
A group consisting of parents and children.
The place where one lives.
Activity involving mental or physical effort.
An institution for educating children.
A medium of exchange for goods and services.
The indefinite continued progress of existence.
A period of 24 hours.
The time between sunset and sunrise.
A period of seven days.
One of the twelve divisions of the year.
The time taken by the Earth to make one revolution around the sun.
The present day.
The day after today.
The day before today.
The early part of the day.
The time between noon and evening.
The time between afternoon and night.
The period from Friday evening to Sunday night.
The first meal of the day.
A meal eaten in the middle of the day.
The main meal of the day, usually eaten in the evening.
Any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink.
A liquid that can be swallowed.
A transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid essential for life.
A drink made from roasted coffee beans.
An aromatic beverage made by pouring hot water over tea leaves.
An opaque white fluid rich in fat and protein.
A staple food made from flour.
A dairy product made from milk.
The sweet and fleshy product of a tree or other plant.
A plant or part of a plant used as food.
The flesh of an animal used as food.
A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills.
A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat.
The oval object produced by a female bird.
Objects that can be moved and used to make a room suitable for living or working.
A separate seat for one person.
A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs.
A piece of furniture for sleeping.
A building for human habitation.
A space that can be occupied.
A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier.
An opening in a wall or vehicle.
A road vehicle with an engine.
A large motor vehicle carrying passengers.
A series of connected vehicles traveling on tracks.
A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings.
A vehicle with two wheels.
Move at a regular and fairly slow pace.
Move at a speed faster than a walk.
Propel the body through water using limbs.
Control a vehicle.
Look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter.
Mark letters, words, or other symbols on a surface.
Give one's attention to a sound.
Say something in order to convey information.
Gain knowledge or skill.
Perceive the intended meaning of.
Engage in activity for enjoyment.
Look at or observe attentively.
Perceive with the eyes.
Be aware of through touching or being touched.
Come into or be in contact with.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
Feeling or showing sorrow.
